comments.body: My understanding was we had some relative/percentage positioning logic, but maybe that doesn't apply to animations?  @Hixie would know.
we can certainly do things using layout instead of media queries, even with animations.
Does that mean your LGTM still stands?  Is there a better way to do this example?

Closest relative position I could find is:
`Point _begin = Point.origin + new FractionalOffset(0.5, 0.2).alongSize(screenSize)`
which is more verbose and doesn't have a Rect equivalent.

I think the current code is fine. Other ways you could do it are to use fractions in the animations, and paint using those in the custom painter (by multiplying by the canvas size). Generally I like to do things that way because then if you put the same canvas inside something else, it keeps working (whereas the media query version only works when it's full-screen). But since this is a concrete demo and not a widget, reuse is not as important.
Sounds like you're good to land. :)
